subtitle: in its entirety the Epic of Gilgamesh
tells the Fantastic tale of the ancient
Mesopotamian King named Gilgamesh who
ruled the area of present-day Iraq many
thousands of years in the past
it describes his Beginnings as a tyrant
and how the gods sought to teach him a
lesson by creating a rival named ankidu
after the two men wrestled to a
stalemate neither better than the other
they become great friends and set off on
a series of Adventures described in
detail within the Epic when enkidu dies
a distraught Gilgamesh spends the rest
of his life searching for the secrets of
eternal life a series of additional
Adventures again narrated by the Epic
it is an unbelievable piece of written
work one which Scholars agree greatly
influenced the Epic literary genre
moving forward through history including
famous works like The Iliad and Homer's
Odyssey
